node.title: Parliament protest: Multicultural NZ calls for govt to engage with leaders
node.description: Multicultural New Zealand is calling on the government to show compassion towards the protesters occupying Parliament grounds.
node.content:
["Multicultural New Zealand (MNZ) is calling on the government to show compassion towards the protesters occupying Parliament grounds.", "", "
Photo: RNZ
", "The non-government body has written to Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern saying while it does not support the protest, it wants the government to make sure that those protesting are listened to.", "President Pancha Narayanan said the message is clear.", "He is reminding Ardern that it is a team of 5 million in this country and while there may be a fringe element in the protest, the government needs to make sure that people's livelihoods and jobs are not being affected by the mandate.", "Narayanan said the government should stand up and be brave enough to talk to the protesters.", "''We encourage you, prime minister and other parliamentarians, to undertake dialogue with the leaders of this protest.", "''We appreciate that talks and steps towards it are not going to be a straightforward process but we see it as imperative towards a de-escalation of tensions.''", "Narayanan said it is a complex situation and therefore the government must be careful with the precedent it sets in dealing with the protesters.", "''We would not want to see the untimely use of force.", "''This is a political protest and it cannot be resolved by government agencies acting on their own without government taking responsibility for the outcome.''", "Follow RNZ's live blog of the protest", "In the letter to the prime minister, Narayanan said there are always three questions Multicultural New Zealand asks to find a way forward with any situation.", "They are: what positive actions we can take as individuals, what positive actions we can take as community groups and what positive actions/ steps the government can take to serve all New Zealanders.", "", "
A protester at the site near Parliament. Photo: RNZ / Angus Dreaver
", "Narayanan said Multicultural New Zealand expects the government's wider intelligence services to be more responsive.", "''We believe there have been successive failures - the failure to pre-empt the Christchurch massacres in 2019 and now this.''", "In the letter he told Ardern that he hopes she will handle the protest with the grace and empathy she has sown with other such challenges and that she considers points raised by his organisation as she responds to the situation."]
